page.title: 04MEET WARMINSTER'S MAYOR!
page.content: Mr Alwyn Curtis, Warminster's Mayor in 1984-5, has a strong commitment to the town - he has lived here for 63 years. As Mayor he was kept very busy because he was invited to attend many local events. For example, Mr Curtis helped to run band concerts raising over Â£500 for charity - one of the events he most enjoyed in his year of office. On top of that, the Mayor chairs meetings of Warminster Town Council. 12 elected Councillors, 6 from the East Ward, 6 from the West Ward, act as "watchdogs" for the town. They check planning applications, make sure local opinions are heard by District and County Councils, and oversee a budget of some Â£22000 a year including Â£2500 in grants to help the local community. Altogether being Mayor meant a lot of responsibility for Mr Curtis, but it has not changed his outlook on life.
